author: EmeraldFlame
body:
## Steps to reproduce

```
Write-Progress -id 1 -Activity 'something' -CurrentOperation 'stuff'
Write-Progress -id 1 -Activity 'something' -CurrentOperation 'more stuff'
Start-Sleep 5
```

## Expected behavior

The 'stuff' current operation would display (possibly too quick to see), but then update to 'more stuff'. 'more stuff' should be visible during the 5 second sleep.

## Actual behavior

'stuff' is written and visible during the 5 second sleep. The 'more stuff' update does not come through.

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Yes, there is a rate limit. The operation is very expensive and significantly slow down script. With the rate limit the script runs as fast as possible but but it brings some side effects.

title: Write-Progress doesn't always update (seems rate limited)
